block.p: Stacey Marie Roth, the daughter of Mary E. and Donald C. Roth of Washington, was married yesterday to Robert Blyth Goergen Jr., a son of Mr. and Mrs. Goergen of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Michael R. Moynihan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Mrs. Goergen, 31, is the director of strategic development and the acting chief financial officer of Onview.com, a New York company that sells fine art on the Internet. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern. Her father is a co-founder and the managing partner of the Emerging Markets Partnership, a private equity fund in Washington that invests in overseas companies. From 1987 to 1992, he was the treasurer of the World Bank in Washington, and is now an adviser to the National Debt Management Agency of the Republic of Ireland.

Stacey Marie Roth, the daughter of Mary E. and Donald C. Roth of Washington, was married yesterday to Robert Blyth Goergen Jr., a son of Mr. and Mrs. Goergen of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Michael R. Moynihan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Mrs. Goergen, 31, is the director of strategic development and the acting chief financial officer of Onview.com, a New York company that sells fine art on the Internet. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern. Her father is a co-founder and the managing partner of the Emerging Markets Partnership, a private equity fund in Washington that invests in overseas companies. From 1987 to 1992, he was the treasurer of the World Bank in Washington, and is now an adviser to the National Debt Management Agency of the Republic of Ireland.

Mr. Goergen, 29, is a managing member in Ropart Investments, a Greenwich venture capital company. He graduated from the University of Richmond and received an M.B.A. degree last month from the University of Pennsylvania. His father is the chairman of both Blyth Industries, a company in Greenwich that makes candles and other scented products, and the Xtra Corporation, a trailer and container leasing company in Boston. He is also the chairman of the University of Rochester.
